item.description:
Every API call requires an Authorization header. You should specify the access token as a Bearer token in the Authorization header of their request. Example

`curl -X $HTTP_METHOD -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" "api_url/$OBJECT"`

request.description:
Endpoint supports google, facebook, twitter providers.
Need to pass social media access token in a raw as "token".

query.description: Supported type values: all, active, expired

request.description: Need to pass site ID in the URL endpoint.

task_id - cloud task id.

percentage_complete - 0 to 100 up to 2 decimal place.

status - 'pending','progress','completed','error'

it's supports following parameters

"domain" ,

"site_id"(app site id),

"ic_site_id"(cloud site id),

"source" (source of abuse report)

response.name: Block Site & User by App Site ID - Admin
Block Site & User by Cloud Site ID - Admin

request.description:
it's supports following parameters

"domain" ,

"site_id"(app site id),

"ic_site_id"(cloud site id),

task_id - cloud task id.

percentage_complete - 0 to 100 up to 2 decimal place.

status - 'pending','progress','completed','error'

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

formdata.description: It can be either plugin, theme or media
